TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed ValidationDataType extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the validation data types used by the and controls.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The ValidationDataType enumeration represents the different data types that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompareValidator> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RangeValidator> controls can validate. When you specify a data type for validation control and the input control being validated passes validation, the value of the input control can be parsed to the specified data type.
## Examples [!code-cs[Classic CompareValidator Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_109_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[Classic CompareValidator Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_109_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.ValidationDataType Currency = int32(4)

Docs.summary: A monetary data type. The value is treated as a <xref:System.Decimal?displayProperty=fullName>. However, currency and grouping symbols are still allowed.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.ValidationDataType Date = int32(3)

Docs.summary: A date data type. Only numeric dates are allowed. The time portion cannot be specified.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.ValidationDataType Double = int32(2)

Docs.summary: A double precision floating point number data type. The value is treated as a <xref:System.Double?displayProperty=fullName>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.ValidationDataType Integer = int32(1)

Docs.summary: A 32-bit signed integer data type. The value is treated as a <xref:System.Int32?displayProperty=fullName>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.ValidationDataType String = int32(0)

Docs.summary: A string data type. The value is treated as a <xref:System.String?displayProperty=fullName>.
